means: 命中注定的事（尤指坏事）

sentence.Network_en: It was just one of those times when you wonder whether the fates conspire against you.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些时候，你会怀疑是不是造化弄人，现在就是如此。

sentence.Network_en: I would repair the fates of the wronged and prevent many tragedies.
sentence.Network_cn: 我也能想办法改变那些曾经被扭曲被冤屈的历史人物的命运,取消很多人类的悲剧.

sentence.Network_en: He was known for his sculpture of the Fates.
sentence.Network_cn: 他以他那座命运三女神的雕塑而闻名.

PerfectNetExp.abs: but probably the only real remedy is for local people to a say in their own fates : in other words , democracy .但真正有效的“药方”是让当地百姓拥有决定自己命运的权利，用其他话来讲，就是施行民主。

entry.def: Fate is a power that some people believe controls and decides everything that happens, in a way that cannot be prevented or changed. You can also refer to the fates .

example.ex: I see no use quarrelling with fate.
example.tran: 我看不出和命运抗争有什么用。

entry.def: A person's or thing's fate is what happens to them.

example.ex: The Russian Parliament will hold a special session later this month to decide his fate...
example.tran: 俄罗斯议会本月晚些时候将举行特别会议决定他的命运。

example.ex: He seems for a moment to be again holding the fate of the country in his hands...
example.tran: 他似乎在一瞬间又一次将国家的命运握在了手中。

entry.def: If something seals a person's or thing's fate, it makes it certain that they will fail or that something unpleasant will happen to them.

example.ex: The call for a boycott could be enough to seal the fate of next week's general election...
example.tran: 抵制选举的呼吁足以注定下周大选失败的命运。

example.ex: And yesterday the Zoo's fate was sealed, largely due to two months of ever-dwindling entrance figures.
example.tran: 昨日，伦敦动物园面临着关闭的命运，主要因为两个月来游客数量持续下滑。

means.word_mean: 1. a group of three goddesses of destiny
